title: A Flow Process Built upon a Batch FoundationPreparation of a Key Amino Alcohol Intermediate via Multistage Continuous Synthesis

reactions.text: As part of synthetic efforts toward protein arginine methyltransferase-5 (PRMT5) inhibitors, a class of promising oncology targets, we required a high-yielding, efficient synthesis of amino alcohol 3b. The batch synthesis (Scheme 1) used large volumes of ammonium hydroxide (NH4OH) solution (∼30 vol, ∼90 equiv) at low temperature with long reaction times, required a seeded isolation of unstable and potentially hazardous intermediate 1, and used the nonpreferred solvent dichloromethane (DCM) for the final workup and isolation of 3b.

Thus, our flow strategy (Scheme 3) was to form 1 from tetrahydroisoquinoline (THIQ) and (R)-ECH in Stage 1A and then quickly convert it to 2 by the addition of exogenous base in Stage 1B. Next, a liquid–liquid extraction (LLE) was performed to remove water-soluble impurities, including the azetidiniums, which we found to be partitioned preferentially into the aqueous layer (see the Supporting Information for details). Aminolysis of the Stage 1B organic solution containing 2 with NH4OH in Stage 2 would furnish 3a.

Numerous solvent/base screens were run in batch to evaluate the Stage 1 conditions (see the Supporting Information for details). Initially the in situ formation of epoxide 2 was investigated by adding a base to the reaction with THIQ and (R)-ECH. We quickly discovered that addition of base in Stage 1 not only promotes the formation of 2 but also gives unacceptably high levels of 4.

Feed 1 was prepared by dissolving THIQ (100 g) in 4:1 v/v t-AmOH/water (2.5 vol, 200 mL of t-AmOH and 50 mL of water). Feed 1 and Feed 2 ((R)-ECH, 138 g) were pumped via a T-joint into an MDAT mixer at 0.495 mL/min and 0.172 mL/min, respectively (see the Supporting Information for a picture of the equipment setup).

The slurry was stirred at 50 °C for 1 h, allowed to cool to ambient temperature, and stirred overnight. The product was isolated by filtration, washed with 95:5 n-BuOH/water (460 mL, 10 vol) followed by industrial methylated spirits (460 mL, 10 vol), and dried at 50 °C overnight, affording ∼50 g of 3b as a white solid (∼64% yield from Stage 1).
